intro: Crotalaria albicaulis, commonly known as the white-stemmed crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with trifoliate leaves and pod-like fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Crotalaria albicaulis is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it beneficial for soil enrichment.
